description.narrative: ARTICLE 19's PPA has four objectives designed to challenge threats to freedom of expression and increase the impact of highly innovative 'niche NGOs' delivering transparency initiatives. A19 will: 1 Defend Freedom of Expression (FoE) and transparency in a multi-polar world: contribute to halting democratic setbacks; re-enforce the regional and international policies for poverty alleviation through a focus on transparency and the free flow of information (MDG 8). 2 Enhance FoE and transparency in a networked world: harness the power of Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs) and media to implement the MDGs by ensuring that FoE principles, including that of universal access, are fully integrated in legal regulations and policies. 3) Protect FoE and transparency against its aggressors: strengthen the role and effectiveness of institutions which are meant to safeguard accountability and ensure that State and Non-State Actors are held accountable for abusing FoE and transparency standards essential to the realisation of all MDGs. 4) Narrow the gaps between principles and practice to deliver real benefits for the poor: empower people living in poverty and their CSOs to access information they need to advocate for better services and tackle some of the causes and consequences of poverty (MDG 3, 5 and 7). To achieve these objectives, A19 will enable CSOs, CBOs, network and processes and strengthen their capacities to secure accountable institutions, through legal and policy support, skills transfer, trainings, and coalition building. We will work simultaneously at grassroots, national and international levels, to ensure that freedom of expression and information grows roots in institutions and society, and fulfils its potential as a mechanism for citizen empowerment and poverty alleviation. ;

mailing-address.narrative: ARTICLE 19 Headquarters Free Word Centre 60 Farringdon Road London EC1R 3GA United Kingdom

sector.narrative: 6300 Bangladesh PPA

description.narrative: ARTICLE 19 will consolidate its work on empowering vulnerable/marginalised persons through realisation of Freedoms of Expression and Information (FoE/I) by building on achievements and learning from the PPA. Having engaged in the SDGs through our global work on FoE/I and transparency, during the PPA extension we will focus our advocacy on building coalitions that will support the monitoring of Goal 16.10 on Right to Information (RTI) and fundamental freedoms. We also will work to ensure strong civil society engagement at the High-level Political Forum meetings in the UN. Using our expertise and findings from our work against impunity, we will link our protection activities closer to using RTI to improve governments’ accountability across the SDGs. We will exit sustainably from pilot projects on RTI and the right to water (Brazil and Kenya), maternal health (Senegal) and environmental sustainability (Bangladesh). We will provide final capacity building, tools and support, encourage partnerships and organise end-of-project workshops to discuss achievements/learning with partners and beneficiaries. These projects’ sustainability is demonstrated by the application of developed tools in other country contexts, i.e. Myanmar.

Having engaged in the SDGs through our global work on FoE/I and transparency, during the PPA extension we will focus our advocacy on building coalitions that will support the monitoring of Goal 16.10 on Right to Information (RTI) and fundamental freedoms. We also will work to ensure strong civil society engagement at the High-level Political Forum meetings in the UN. Using our expertise and findings from our work against impunity, we will link our protection activities closer to using RTI to improve governments’ accountability across the SDGs. We will exit sustainably from pilot projects on RTI and the right to water (Brazil and Kenya), maternal health (Senegal) and environmental sustainability (Bangladesh). We will provide final capacity building, tools and support, encourage partnerships and organise end-of-project workshops to discuss achievements/learning with partners and beneficiaries. These projects’ sustainability is demonstrated by the application of developed tools in other country contexts, i.e. Myanmar.

Having engaged in the SDGs through our global work on FoE/I and transparency, during the PPA extension we will focus our advocacy on building coalitions that will support the monitoring of Goal 16.10 on Right to Information (RTI) and fundamental freedoms. We also will work to ensure strong civil society engagement at the High-level Political Forum meetings in the UN. Using our expertise and findings from our work against impunity, we will link our protection activities closer to using RTI to improve governments’ accountability across the SDGs. We will exit sustainably from pilot projects on RTI and the right to water (Brazil and Kenya), maternal health (Senegal) and environmental sustainability (Bangladesh). We will provide final capacity building, tools and support, encourage partnerships and organise end-of-project workshops to discuss achievements/learning with partners and beneficiaries. These projects’ sustainability is demonstrated by the application of developed tools in other country contexts, i.e. Myanmar.

description.narrative: gender activists and organisations working on sexual and reproductive health are confident in using the right to information as a tool to gain access to the government’s plans, policies and budgets to implement the National Strategy for the Advancement of Women commitments on providing information and services relating to sexual and reproductive health.
